title: dump or get heap profile failed
body:
## Bug Report

<!-- Thanks for your bug report! Don't worry if you can't fill out all the sections. -->

### What version of TiKV are you using?
<!-- You can run `tikv-server --version` -->
```bash
[root@tc-tikv-1 /]# ./tikv-server  -V
TiKV
Release Version:   7.6.0-alpha
Edition:           Community
Git Commit Hash:   213299221806959c95d05d0f2d7368e597fa9281
Git Commit Branch: heads/refs/tags/v7.6.0-alpha
UTC Build Time:    2023-12-07 11:47:05
Rust Version:      rustc 1.67.0-nightly (96ddd32c4 2022-11-14)
Enable Features:   pprof-fp jemalloc mem-profiling portable sse test-engine-kv-rocksdb test-engine-raft-raft-engine cloud-aws cloud-gcp cloud-azure openssl-vendored
Profile:           dist_release
```
### What operating system and CPU are you using?
<!-- If you're using Linux, you can run `cat /proc/cpuinfo` -->
```bash
Linux tc-tikv-1 3.10.0-957.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Thu Nov 8 23:39:32 UTC 2018 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
```
### Steps to reproduce
<!-- If possible, provide a recipe for reproducing the error. A complete runnable program is good. -->
1. deploy a tidb cluster with tikv
2. enable the continuous profiling
3. check tikv log
### What did you expect?
heap profile can see in the dashboard
### What did happened?
